column4: hey guys, am not able to start ubuntu in gnome, can someone help me fix it?
http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-780179.html my problem is similar to this, i need a  way to fix it!
explain your situation.
i ran into a HDD problem due to loose connections in the power cord, some data corrupted
once i fixed it, its been working fine but i ran fsck on a mounted partition once [might be a problem?]
are you still seeing issues?  Or is the issue that you can't load Gnome?
no issues now
it was just a loose power cord, i stuck it to place now, i dont get HDD errors anymore
so I guess my question is, what problem(s) are you having right now?  Or questions?
gnome doesn't start!
any error messages?
i tried KDE too, that doesn't either, but e16 and fluxbox work
Try booting into recovery mode in grub and try to repair packages.
An error occurred while loading or saving configuration information for firefox. Some of your configuration settings may not work properly. <-- replace firefox with most gnome app names
i tried that, dint work!
I'm not an expert, but it still sounds like you have some filesystem issues.  And like psywiped said, his command won't hurt anything.  You can try:  sudo apt-get install gnome-desktop
did that already, no effect!
you did:  sudo apt-get install gnome-desktop ??
as psywiped said, try:  sudo apt-get install ubuntu
sudo apt-get install gnome-desktop. . . E: Couldn't find package ubuntu
if the problem was on another PC.  We're only trying to help you.
reinstall Ubuntu over your current installation.
with data corruption like you've got, I think your only safe alternative is to get an Ubuntu live CD and reinstall over top of the currently existing one.
psywiped: thanks for the help guys, need to leave! adios
